official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to delay the
		  application of the individual health insurance mandate for individuals who have
		  not attained age 27.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Delay of application of
			 individual health insurance mandate for individuals who have not attained age
			 27

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 subsection:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5000A of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect
				to any individual who has not attained age 27 as of December 31,
				2013.

text.#text:
In the case of any month beginning before
				January 1, 2015, no penalty shall be imposed under

header.#text:
Delayed
				application to individuals who have not attained age 27

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1501 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall take effect as if
			 included in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2950 IH: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to delay the application of the individual health insurance mandate for individuals who have not attained age 27.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
